page.title: 10Farming
page.content: Fickleshole farm was mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086.The farm is owned by Mr. Daniels who lives in London but is managed by Mr. Griffin.He lives there in the 200 year old farmhouse.Mr.Daniels owns 465 acres including 268 acres of arable land,80 acres of pasture,80 acres of maintained woodland from which he cuts wood for fencing.The arable land is used to grow rape for oil(154 acres),malting barley(74 acres),peas for pigeon feed(18 acres),evening primrose for health oil(5 acres),26 acres of field beans and 6 acres of turnips and swede for feeding the 70 beef cattle and 70 ewes that are fattened on the farm from late autumn to spring each year.The crops change according to the time of year and according to the contracts that the farmer manages to win.
